content.webTitle: Derbyshire sign Australia batsman Usman Khawaja for next season

fields.headline: Derbyshire sign Australia batsman Usman Khawaja for next season
fields.bodyText: Usman Khawaja, the great hope for Australian cricket, has signed to play for Derbyshire next season. The 24-year-old who was born in Rawalpindi and made a promising debut in England's crushing Ashes-clinching win in Sydney, has asked Cricket Australia for permission to join the Second Division county from April to July. John Morris, Derbyshire's director of cricket, said: "Successful stints in County Cricket have played an integral part in the development of many successful Australian cricketers and I'm sure Usman will benefit hugely from this experience. "He has scored runs consistently for New South Wales and is also proving to be a very entertaining player to watch."
